intro: Malvastrum corymbosum, commonly known as the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads that are surrounded by pale green bracts, creating a striking visual effect. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
